alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 7:37PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Tammany and eastern Washington Parishes, Hancock and Pearl River Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Varnado to near Slidell. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Bogalusa, Picayune, Waveland, Poplarville, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Varnado, Sun, Kiln, Crossroads, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center, Bush, Mcneil, Lacombe, Angie and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 266 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 12 between mile markers 75 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington
